meanings.definition: To disassemble a firearm for cleaning or maintenance.
meanings.sent1: Soldiers learn fieldstripping to keep their guns clean and working well.
meanings.sent2: I need to fieldstrip my rifle after a day at the shooting range.
meanings.sent3: Why did the gun refuse to go to the party? Because it needed some fieldstripping first!
meanings.sent4: Fieldstripping a gun is like unraveling a mystery to reveal its inner workings.
meanings.sent5: The instructor demonstrated fieldstripping with precision and expertise.

meanings.definition: The act of removing the outer casing or cover of a piece of equipment for maintenance or repair.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic performed fieldstripping on the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent2: Fieldstripping the computer revealed a loose wire causing the problem.
meanings.sent3: Why did the broken radio go to the doctor? It needed some fieldstripping!
meanings.sent4: The fieldstripping of the old car exposed years of neglect and wear.
meanings.sent5: The technician's fieldstripping was thorough and efficient.
